title: [英文時態] 到底係文法書錯定鬼佬錯? 問左兩個鬼佬 同答案都唔同 有冇高手識解呢題?

replies.msg:
"Grammar in Use"

For the last six months Carolyn _______(be) in Mexico－at the moment ______(work) in a school as a teaching assistant. She's coming back to England next month, and when she comes back.

書答案:
has been (correct)
she's working (correct)

[She has been working shows that she started in the past and her actions continue to this day. She was working shows that it was over a period of time but now it is finished.]

[This is a tricky one. When I first read it I thought "was" was correct as well. The giveaway is the "- at the moment" part. It means it's still happening, so you need "has been". She has been there and still is ("at the moment"). You can't use "she's working" because you're talking about the PAST six months (and now).]

好似兩個都話 用was working

其實係咪
"For the last six months"(Recently)
唔同"last six months"(Past)?
"at the moment"(now/Recently?) 唔係講緊過去既果個moment
所以 she's working 先岩?

佢而家仲係Mexico做緊ta 所以用has been
如果was working就代表已經唔係working in Mexico

少少棘手

第一個係因為由以前到而家都係喺墨西哥，所以係用perfect continuous, 即係has been.

第二個佢個關鍵詞係at the moment，即係現時，所以係用is working.
